speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: SCENE IV. A hall in the same.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter KENT, disguised

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If but as well I other accents borrow,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That can my speech defuse, my good intent

speaker: KENT
text_entry: May carry through itself to that full issue

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For which I razed my likeness. Now, banish'd Kent,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If thou canst serve where thou dost stand condemn'd,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: So may it come, thy master, whom thou lovest,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Shall find thee full of labours.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Horns within. Enter KING LEAR, Knights, and Attendants

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let me not stay a jot for dinner; go get it ready.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now! what art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A man, sir.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What dost thou profess? what wouldst thou with us?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I do profess to be no less than I seem; to serve

speaker: KENT
text_entry: him truly that will put me in trust: to love him

speaker: KENT
text_entry: that is honest; to converse with him that is wise,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: and says little; to fear judgment; to fight when I

speaker: KENT
text_entry: cannot choose; and to eat no fish.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: A very honest-hearted fellow, and as poor as the king.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If thou be as poor for a subject as he is for a

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: king, thou art poor enough. What wouldst thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Service.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who wouldst thou serve?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: You.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dost thou know me, fellow?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, sir; but you have that in your countenance

speaker: KENT
text_entry: which I would fain call master.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Authority.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What services canst thou do?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I can keep honest counsel, ride, run, mar a curious

speaker: KENT
text_entry: tale in telling it, and deliver a plain message

speaker: KENT
text_entry: bluntly: that which ordinary men are fit for, I am

speaker: KENT
text_entry: qualified in; and the best of me is diligence.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How old art thou?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Not so young, sir, to love a woman for singing, nor

speaker: KENT
text_entry: so old to dote on her for any thing: I have years

speaker: KENT
text_entry: on my back forty eight.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Follow me; thou shalt serve me: if I like thee no

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: worse after dinner, I will not part from thee yet.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dinner, ho, dinner! Where's my knave? my fool?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go you, and call my fool hither.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter OSWALD

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: You, you, sirrah, where's my daughter?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: So please you,--

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What says the fellow there? Call the clotpoll back.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit a Knight

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Where's my fool, ho? I think the world's asleep.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Re-enter Knight

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now! where's that mongrel?

speaker: Knight
text_entry: He says, my lord, your daughter is not well.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why came not the slave back to me when I called him.

speaker: Knight
text_entry: Sir, he answered me in the roundest manner, he would

speaker: Knight
text_entry: not.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: He would not!

speaker: Knight
text_entry: My lord, I know not what the matter is; but, to my

speaker: Knight
text_entry: judgment, your highness is not entertained with that

speaker: Knight
text_entry: ceremonious affection as you were wont; there's a

speaker: Knight
text_entry: great abatement of kindness appears as well in the

speaker: Knight
text_entry: general dependants as in the duke himself also and

speaker: Knight
text_entry: your daughter.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ha! sayest thou so?

speaker: Knight
text_entry: I beseech you, pardon me, my lord, if I be mistaken;

speaker: Knight
text_entry: for my duty cannot be silent when I think your

speaker: Knight
text_entry: highness wronged.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou but rememberest me of mine own conception: I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have perceived a most faint neglect of late; which I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have rather blamed as mine own jealous curiosity

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: than as a very pretence and purpose of unkindness:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I will look further into't. But where's my fool? I

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: have not seen him this two days.

speaker: Knight
text_entry: Since my young lady's going into France, sir, the

speaker: Knight
text_entry: fool hath much pined away.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No more of that; I have noted it well. Go you, and

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: tell my daughter I would speak with her.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Go you, call hither my fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Re-enter OSWALD

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, you sir, you, come you hither, sir: who am I,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: sir?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: My lady's father.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: 'My lady's father'! my lord's knave: your

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: whoreson dog! you slave! you cur!

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I am none of these, my lord; I beseech your pardon.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do you bandy looks with me, you rascal?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Striking him

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: I'll not be struck, my lord.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Nor tripped neither, you base football player.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Tripping up his heels

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I thank thee, fellow; thou servest me, and I'll

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: love thee.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Come, sir, arise, away! I'll teach you differences:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: away, away! if you will measure your lubber's

speaker: KENT
text_entry: length again, tarry: but away! go to; have you

speaker: KENT
text_entry: wisdom? so.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Pushes OSWALD out

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Now, my friendly knave, I thank thee: there's

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: earnest of thy service.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Giving KENT money

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Enter Fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Let me hire him too: here's my coxcomb.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Offering KENT his cap

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now, my pretty knave! how dost thou?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Sirrah, you were best take my coxcomb.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Why, fool?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, for taking one's part that's out of favour:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nay, an thou canst not smile as the wind sits,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou'lt catch cold shortly: there, take my coxcomb:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: why, this fellow has banished two on's daughters,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and did the third a blessing against his will; if

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou follow him, thou must needs wear my coxcomb.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: How now, nuncle! Would I had two coxcombs and two daughters!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, my boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If I gave them all my living, I'ld keep my coxcombs

speaker: Fool
text_entry: myself. There's mine; beg another of thy daughters.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Take heed, sirrah; the whip.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Truth's a dog must to kennel; he must be whipped

speaker: Fool
text_entry: out, when Lady the brach may stand by the fire and stink.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A pestilent gall to me!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Sirrah, I'll teach thee a speech.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Do.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Mark it, nuncle:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Have more than thou showest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Speak less than thou knowest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Lend less than thou owest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Ride more than thou goest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Learn more than thou trowest,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Set less than thou throwest;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Leave thy drink and thy whore,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And keep in-a-door,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And thou shalt have more

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Than two tens to a score.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This is nothing, fool.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then 'tis like the breath of an unfee'd lawyer; you

speaker: Fool
text_entry: gave me nothing for't. Can you make no use of

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nothing, nuncle?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Why, no, boy; nothing can be made out of nothing.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: [To KENT]  Prithee, tell him, so much the rent of

speaker: Fool
text_entry: his land comes to: he will not believe a fool.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A bitter fool!

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Dost thou know the difference, my boy, between a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: bitter fool and a sweet fool?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No, lad; teach me.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That lord that counsell'd thee

speaker: Fool
text_entry: To give away thy land,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Come place him here by me,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Do thou for him stand:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The sweet and bitter fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Will presently appear;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The one in motley here,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The other found out there.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dost thou call me fool, boy?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: All thy other titles thou hast given away; that

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou wast born with.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This is not altogether fool, my lord.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: No, faith, lords and great men will not let me; if

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I had a monopoly out, they would have part on't:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and ladies too, they will not let me have all fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: to myself; they'll be snatching. Give me an egg,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: nuncle, and I'll give thee two crowns.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What two crowns shall they be?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Why, after I have cut the egg i' the middle, and eat

speaker: Fool
text_entry: up the meat, the two crowns of the egg. When thou

speaker: Fool
text_entry: clovest thy crown i' the middle, and gavest away

speaker: Fool
text_entry: both parts, thou borest thy ass on thy back o'er

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the dirt: thou hadst little wit in thy bald crown,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: when thou gavest thy golden one away. If I speak

speaker: Fool
text_entry: like myself in this, let him be whipped that first

speaker: Fool
text_entry: finds it so.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Singing

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Fools had ne'er less wit in a year;

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For wise men are grown foppish,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: They know not how their wits to wear,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Their manners are so apish.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When were you wont to be so full of songs, sirrah?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I have used it, nuncle, ever since thou madest thy

speaker: Fool
text_entry: daughters thy mothers: for when thou gavest them

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the rod, and put'st down thine own breeches,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Singing

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Then they for sudden joy did weep,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And I for sorrow sung,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That such a king should play bo-peep,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And go the fools among.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Prithee, nuncle, keep a schoolmaster that can teach

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thy fool to lie: I would fain learn to lie.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: An you lie, sirrah, we'll have you whipped.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: I marvel what kin thou and thy daughters are:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: they'll have me whipped for speaking true, thou'lt

speaker: Fool
text_entry: have me whipped for lying; and sometimes I am

speaker: Fool
text_entry: whipped for holding my peace. I had rather be any

speaker: Fool
text_entry: kind o' thing than a fool: and yet I would not be

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thee, nuncle; thou hast pared thy wit o' both sides,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: and left nothing i' the middle: here comes one o'

speaker: Fool
text_entry: the parings.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Enter GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How now, daughter! what makes that frontlet on?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Methinks you are too much of late i' the frown.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Thou wast a pretty fellow when thou hadst no need to

speaker: Fool
text_entry: care for her frowning; now thou art an O without a

speaker: Fool
text_entry: figure: I am better than thou art now; I am a fool,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: thou art nothing.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: To GONERIL

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Yes, forsooth, I will hold my tongue; so your face

speaker: Fool
text_entry: bids me, though you say nothing. Mum, mum,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: He that keeps nor crust nor crum,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Weary of all, shall want some.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Pointing to KING LEAR

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That's a shealed peascod.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not only, sir, this your all-licensed fool,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: But other of your insolent retinue

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Do hourly carp and quarrel; breaking forth

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: In rank and not-to-be endured riots. Sir,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I had thought, by making this well known unto you,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To have found a safe redress; but now grow fearful,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By what yourself too late have spoke and done.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That you protect this course, and put it on

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By your allowance; which if you should, the fault

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Would not 'scape censure, nor the redresses sleep,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Which, in the tender of a wholesome weal,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Might in their working do you that offence,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Which else were shame, that then necessity

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Will call discreet proceeding.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: For, you trow, nuncle,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: The hedge-sparrow fed the cuckoo so long,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: That it's had it head bit off by it young.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: So, out went the candle, and we were left darkling.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are you our daughter?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Come, sir,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: I would you would make use of that good wisdom,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Whereof I know you are fraught; and put away

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: These dispositions, that of late transform you

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: From what you rightly are.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: May not an ass know when the cart

speaker: Fool
text_entry: draws the horse? Whoop, Jug! I love thee.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Doth any here know me? This is not Lear:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Doth Lear walk thus? speak thus? Where are his eyes?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Either his notion weakens, his discernings

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Are lethargied--Ha! waking? 'tis not so.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who is it that can tell me who I am?

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Lear's shadow.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I would learn that; for, by the

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: marks of sovereignty, knowledge, and reason,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I should be false persuaded I had daughters.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Which they will make an obedient father.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Your name, fair gentlewoman?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This admiration, sir, is much o' the savour

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Of other your new pranks. I do beseech you

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To understand my purposes aright:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As you are old and reverend, you should be wise.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Here do you keep a hundred knights and squires;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Men so disorder'd, so debosh'd and bold,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That this our court, infected with their manners,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Shows like a riotous inn: epicurism and lust

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Make it more like a tavern or a brothel

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Than a graced palace. The shame itself doth speak

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: For instant remedy: be then desired

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: By her, that else will take the thing she begs,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: A little to disquantity your train;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And the remainder, that shall still depend,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To be such men as may besort your age,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And know themselves and you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Darkness and devils!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Saddle my horses; call my train together:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Degenerate bastard! I'll not trouble thee.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Yet have I left a daughter.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You strike my people; and your disorder'd rabble

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Make servants of their betters.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter ALBANY

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Woe, that too late repents,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To ALBANY

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, sir, are you come?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Is it your will? Speak, sir. Prepare my horses.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Ingratitude, thou marble-hearted fiend,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: More hideous when thou show'st thee in a child

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Than the sea-monster!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Pray, sir, be patient.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: [To GONERIL]  Detested kite! thou liest.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My train are men of choice and rarest parts,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That all particulars of duty know,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And in the most exact regard support

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The worships of their name. O most small fault,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How ugly didst thou in Cordelia show!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That, like an engine, wrench'd my frame of nature

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: From the fix'd place; drew from heart all love,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And added to the gall. O Lear, Lear, Lear!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beat at this gate, that let thy folly in,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Striking his head

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And thy dear judgment out! Go, go, my people.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: My lord, I am guiltless, as I am ignorant

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Of what hath moved you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: It may be so, my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hear, nature, hear; dear goddess, hear!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Suspend thy purpose, if thou didst intend

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To make this creature fruitful!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Into her womb convey sterility!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dry up in her the organs of increase;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And from her derogate body never spring

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A babe to honour her! If she must teem,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Create her child of spleen; that it may live,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And be a thwart disnatured torment to her!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let it stamp wrinkles in her brow of youth;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With cadent tears fret channels in her cheeks;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Turn all her mother's pains and benefits

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To laughter and contempt; that she may feel

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To have a thankless child! Away, away!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Now, gods that we adore, whereof comes this?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Never afflict yourself to know the cause;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: But let his disposition have that scope

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: That dotage gives it.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Re-enter KING LEAR

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: What, fifty of my followers at a clap!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Within a fortnight!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: What's the matter, sir?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I'll tell thee:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To GONERIL

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Life and death! I am ashamed

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That thou hast power to shake my manhood thus;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That these hot tears, which break from me perforce,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Should make thee worth them. Blasts and fogs upon thee!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The untented woundings of a father's curse

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pierce every sense about thee! Old fond eyes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beweep this cause again, I'll pluck ye out,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And cast you, with the waters that you lose,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To temper clay. Yea, it is come to this?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let is be so: yet have I left a daughter,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Who, I am sure, is kind and comfortable:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When she shall hear this of thee, with her nails

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She'll flay thy wolvish visage. Thou shalt find

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That I'll resume the shape which thou dost think

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I have cast off for ever: thou shalt,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I warrant thee.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Exeunt KING LEAR, KENT, and Attendants

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Do you mark that, my lord?

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I cannot be so partial, Goneril,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: To the great love I bear you,--

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Pray you, content. What, Oswald, ho!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: To the Fool

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You, sir, more knave than fool, after your master.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Nuncle Lear, nuncle Lear, tarry and take the fool

speaker: Fool
text_entry: with thee.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: A fox, when one has caught her,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: And such a daughter,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Should sure to the slaughter,

speaker: Fool
text_entry: If my cap would buy a halter:

speaker: Fool
text_entry: So the fool follows after.

speaker: Fool
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This man hath had good counsel:--a hundred knights!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: 'Tis politic and safe to let him keep

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: At point a hundred knights: yes, that, on every dream,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Each buzz, each fancy, each complaint, dislike,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: He may enguard his dotage with their powers,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And hold our lives in mercy. Oswald, I say!

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Well, you may fear too far.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Safer than trust too far:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Let me still take away the harms I fear,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Not fear still to be taken: I know his heart.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What he hath utter'd I have writ my sister

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: If she sustain him and his hundred knights

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: When I have show'd the unfitness,--

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Re-enter OSWALD

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: How now, Oswald!

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: What, have you writ that letter to my sister?

speaker: OSWALD
text_entry: Yes, madam.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Take you some company, and away to horse:

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Inform her full of my particular fear;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And thereto add such reasons of your own

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As may compact it more. Get you gone;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And hasten your return.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exit OSWALD

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: No, no, my lord,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: This milky gentleness and course of yours

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Though I condemn not, yet, under pardon,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You are much more attask'd for want of wisdom

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Than praised for harmful mildness.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: How far your eyes may pierce I can not tell:

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Striving to better, oft we mar what's well.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Nay, then--

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Well, well; the event.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exeunt
